instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: MacBook Air 13" - 820-00165-A - not turning on/orange light - u6100 corroded
threads.message:
Hey guys,

hope you can help me with this one.

Board is looking nice, except u6100 area.

PP3V3_S5 is present

P3V3SUS_EN is not present...?!

PP3V3_SUS is like 0.01V

Should i replace U6100 directly? Or any other options first to check?


[ATTACH type="full"]60570[/ATTACH]


Thank you!

threads.title: MacBook Air 13" - 820-00165-A - not turning on/orange light - u6100 corroded
threads.message:
You must clean the corrosion and replace damaged components.
Remove U6100, clean its pads and ones from board; check traces continuity and resolder back the chip.
Check diode mode to ground on 3V3_SUS; w/ and w/o U6100 in place.

Do not reflash BIOS yet.
Only change U6100 if it causes short.

threads.title: MacBook Air 13" - 820-00165-A - not turning on/orange light - u6100 corroded
threads.message:
Hi!

Just gave some flux and hot air to the U6100 to see what happens: (had light before the whole time)

no light at all - and i discovered that u7090 looks like shit

[ATTACH type="full"]60571[/ATTACH]


hows that/is it possible?!


replace u7090 and fix traces - should be a working machine?!

threads.title: MacBook Air 13" - 820-00165-A - not turning on/orange light - u6100 corroded
threads.message:
U7090 is the 3V42_G3H power supply.
Did you test the machine now?

threads.title: MacBook Air 13" - 820-00165-A - not turning on/orange light - u6100 corroded
threads.message:
update:

replaced u7090; jumper wire to r7080

PP3V42_G3H is 1.7V

PPBUS_G3H is 0.5 something


what´s going on with this machine?

threads.title: MacBook Air 13" - 820-00165-A - not turning on/orange light - u6100 corroded
threads.message:
Post U7090 voltages.
Also check diode mode to ground at 3V42_G3H and PPBUS_G3H.

threads.title: MacBook Air 13" - 820-00165-A - not turning on/orange light - u6100 corroded
threads.message:
pin 6, 8: 2,7

diode mode to ground: both: 0.333
